  physical_appearance: This is a gelatin silver print and the image captured has a central focus on a half dressed man balancing on a composite supporting structure made of wooden rods joint together. With his arms outstretched
 he is seen reaching out for the next rod with his right hand.  The person in the photograph is actually the artist himself.

  subject_terms_1: self-portraits stylized portraits rods (object genre)

  subject_terms_2: Photography
 Artistic  Portrait photography  Building

  subject_terms_3: Artistic photography  Portrait photography  Building and Construction

  sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. These photos are typical of the salon photography style of the time
 with an emphasis on technique
 composition and tone. The cleaner in this photo is actually the photographer himself.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. These photos are typical of the salon photography style of the time, with an emphasis on technique, composition and tone. The cleaner in this photo is actually the photographer himself.
